captions.text: After feeding Yuan Zai some milk this early morning
the Taipei Zoo keepers are moving Yuan Zai to her mother's den for the first time
Everyone is anxious
No one can anticipate how the mother panda, Yuan Yuan, will react to reuniting with Yuan Zai
Our keeper places Yuan Zai in front of Yuan Yuan's den first
For Yuan Yuan to see Yuan Zai and familiarize herself with her scent
Then we have Yuan Yuan wait outside the delivery room for a bit
She seems to understand what's about the happen
and is restless
At the other gate to the delivery room
our keeper carefully picks Yuan Zai up
and brings her inside the room
Yuan Yuan keeps pacing by the door as soon as she sees Yuan Zai
Once the staff finishes all the preparation work
we open the gate
Everyone is nervously watching the interaction between Yuan Yuan and Yuan Zai
Yuan Yuan walks over to Yuan Zai's side instantly
She makes a few tries to pick Yuan Zai up, then holds her closely
At first Yuan Zai finds the new bed uncomfortable
and keeps vocalizing
Yuan Yuan looks like someone who's taking care of a friend's baby
facing a fussy and crying baby
is uncertain what to do
She tries to hold Yuan Zai closely first
Then she tries sitting or lying down to see if Yuan Zai will stop crying
After repeated attempts
she finally finds the perfect cuddling position
Yuan Zai also starts nursing contentedly
After a while everyone is worn out
Yuan Zai is tired by now and stops crying
Yuan Yuan is also exhausted from comforting and feeding her baby
and fell asleep next to Yuan Zai
Every staff is relieved
and can't help but smile at this scene
Mother panda, baby panda, and all keepers are all spent
To help Yuan Yuan conserve energy
and to give her and Yuan Zai some time to adapt
we will not leave Yuan Zai with Yuan Yuan  right away
but we will make sure they spend time together every day
To retrieve Yuan Zai from Yuan Yuan, we use honey to distract her
We are getting ready to take Yuan Zai
At first Yuan Yuan is not tempted
Eventually she cannot resist her beloved honey
and moves her bottom
so we can successfully retrieve Yuan Zai
Yuan Zai falls sound asleep immediately in the incubator
Today marks the first major milestone in Yuan Yuan and Yuan Zai's reunion

title: 圓仔回到媽媽懷抱 Giant Panda Cub Yuan Zai Reunited with Mother Panda, Yuan Yuan (English Subtitle Available)

comments.author: Virginia Vegan Greenwood-Warner

comments.text:
+Carmen W Stick to the topic at hand of what I said. We Have ZERO right to 
hold in captivity any wild animals. 
Not talking about pets, vaccines. doctors. computers, cell phone, medical, 
or technology as you suggested. 
You really think humans are trying their best to keep things under control 
is not only your opinion it's a fantasy. Humans are the one and only reason 
this planet is so fucked up in every way shape and form which are totally 
different conversations. Quite frankly if humans are displaying their best 
as your suggesting then our best needs to be hung out to dry right away 
since its a complete pouch screw as well as a complete embarrassment.
However and again stick to the topic at hand we have ZERO right holding in 
captivity wild animals.
comments.author: Michelle Sullivan

comments.text:
+Pinscher Graphics Do you have any pets by any chance? Do you know anyone 
with pets? What is your stance on that? Mother Nature also has its 
imperfections. If we really let nature take its own course, then many 
humans (and animals) would have already been dead. Do you ever get 
vaccinated or visit the doctor? Are you using your computer now or do you 
own a cell phone? Medical intervention and technology also defies Mother 
Nature. I think many humans are trying their best to keep things under 
control because the spread of urbanization and technology is inevitable.
comments.author: Carmen W

comments.text:
+Laura Agrusti Sadly I am right. Although it's not a matter of any of us 
being right or not, it's a matter of doing what's right for the animals. 
many will fire back stating that they are doing the right things for the 
animals. Are we? Really? Many state there are animals in captivity in order 
to save endangered species with that being said we are doing the right 
thing would be their claim. In reality nature has this thing called natural 
selection therefore we have no right to involve ourselves in that process. 
Further more should any human want to do the "right thing" to save a 
endangered species then the right formula to that problem would be to stop 
hunting these animals for game and stop taking their habitat away from 
them. People take in in predators right? Such as let's say a Lioness. They 
cage her and feed her and think it's all good. Good for who is the 
question. Good for their own self fulfillment? Or good for their 
pocketbook? Certainly it's not good for the animal. The animal didn't sign 
up for this. A predator not only wants to be free like every other living 
species including us. Predators want to hunt, they don't want to be fed. 
Some things are so perfect nothing has the right to attempt to alter that. 
Mother nature is one of those things that's just that perfect that again we 
have ZERO right to mess with.
comments.author: Michelle Sullivan

comments.text: You are right Pinscher! <3

I don't think she's in the cage 24/7. In China, these pandas are a national

do go outside to play. You may want to read the full story about this 
particular baby panda before jumping to conclusions. I think the baby panda 
was injured and had to be kept in an incubator.

「圓仔」已經39日齡了，體重突破1千7百公克。一般的大貓熊幼仔通常約45天大時才­會睜開眼睛，園方為了讓「圓仔」睜開眼睛時第一眼看見的就是媽媽「圓圓」，經過與大陸­專家會議討論，現在的「圓仔」傷口復原狀況良好非常的健康，是隻活潑好動的大貓熊幼仔­，且前些日子與媽媽「圓圓」的互動關係良好，因此經過多次的評估與謹慎的觀察，決定讓­「圓仔」回到媽媽「圓圓」的懷抱。!!! 
:D﻿

Giant 
Panda是熊科，這個經過幾十年的討論驗證DNA得出的結論，為什麼在大陸會是熊貓，那是因為在舊時代讀書是從右往左念的，念錯名字了；就像香港很多地名路名一樣，中英文的字音意思完全不一樣，也是因為把英文名字從右往左念錯了。

comments.text:
If anyone here is interested, the TAIPEI Zoo's Youtube account (accessible 
above) has many videos detailing Daddy Tuantuan, Mommy Yuanyuan and baby 
Yuanzai. Baby (now cub) Yuanzai is now 9 months of age, and a healthy, 
happy, mischievous little girl. There is also an 1-hour LIVE showing at 
1600pm Taiwan time (8am UTC) that shows the family of 3 at 
http://hichannel.hinet.net/panda/﻿
